newsitem.title: JAPAN: TOCOM PGMS END SHARPLY HIGHER ON SHORT-COVERING.
newsitem.headline: TOCOM PGMS END SHARPLY HIGHER ON SHORT-COVERING.

text.p: Yen-based platinum group metal (PGMs) futures reversed sharp downward corrections of the past two days to end sharply higher on Friday on animated short-covering by private investors, traders said.
Most palladium futures ended up by their 48 yen per gram daily limits and some months of platinum had jumped by their 75 yen per gram limit by the close.
"Despite the arrival of August PGM shipments from Russia, private investors facing losses were forced to cover their short positions, especially in palladium," a trader at a trading house said.
Gold futures also ended higher after lacklustre trade following sharp gains in PGM futures.
In gold futures, most private investors were sidelined.
"Gold futures were purely lifted by PGM gains. Sentiment in gold is basically bearish," another trader said.
Gold futures ranged from seven yen to 13 yen per gram higher, with benchmark June ending up 12 yen at 1,213 yen.
In the bullion market, spot gold was quoted at $321.85/322.25 per ounce at 0735 GMT, against $321.70/322.20 in New York on Thursday.
Benchmark June silver was up 0.3 yen at 169.0 yen.
